p: Cuba has more than 25 pest management programs, with two different approaches [ 44]. For intensive crops (e.g., potatoes, tomatoes), an IPM scheme is used, integrating synthetic pesticides with biological control. The other approach focuses on crops grown on small farms and urban agriculture and uses agro-ecological management (APM), including biological control, biopesticides, agronomic practices (e.g., crop rotation, polycropping, soil covers), and functional integration of auxiliary vegetation structures.
